publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-8 Rhona Brankin: Future of the Scottish Agricultural College—That the Parliament welcomes the decision of the Scottish Agricultural College to consolidate its main education and research facilities at King’s Buildings and the Bush Estate; notes that the decision is based on the major options appraisal carried out by Deloitte and Touche to achieve the best configuration of service delivery that is both operationally and financially sustainable for the whole of Scotland; recognises the importance of maintaining the existing advisory and consultancy services throughout Scotland, and recognises the vital strategic importance of the decision to the Scottish Executive's bioscience cluster strategy for the Lothians and for Scotland. Supported by: Mr John Home Robertson*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-8 Future of the Scottish Agricultural College (lodged on 12 May 2003) Margo MacDonald*

S2M-8 Rhona Brankin: Future of the Scottish Agricultural College—That the Parliament welcomes the decision of the Scottish Agricultural College to consolidate its main education and research facilities at King’s Buildings and the Bush Estate; notes that the decision is based on the major options appraisal carried out by Deloitte and Touche to achieve the best configuration of service delivery that is both operationally and financially sustainable for the whole of Scotland; recognises the importance of maintaining the existing advisory and consultancy services throughout Scotland, and recognises the vital strategic importance of the decision to the Scottish Executive's bioscience cluster strategy for the Lothians and for Scotland. Supported by: Mr John Home Robertson, Sarah Boyack, Margo MacDonald
S2M-8 Future of the Scottish Agricultural College (lodged on 12 May 2003) Scott Barrie*, Jeremy Purvis*
S2M-8 Future of the Scottish Agricultural College (lodged on 12 May 2003) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-8 Future of the Scottish Agricultural College (lodged on 12 May 2003) Christine May*, Bristow Muldoon*
